name: yarrow cardigan
notes:
simple, seamless, and adaptable! this easy, cropped cardigan pattern uses bamboo yarn and single and double crochet stitches to create an essential wardrobe piece. modify the length, skip the buttons, but whatever you do, don’t miss the chance to make your next favorite toss-on cardi.

advanced beginner level skills you’ll practice include single crochet, double crochet, meeting gauge and working in the round. because the sweater is worked in one piece, you won't have anything to seam at the end!


pattern is written in nine sizes–extra small to 5x and requires approximately 1250-2250 yards of lion brand truboo or similar yarn.

the sample pictured is a m on a 5’9” model with a 38” bust.  the cardigan is meant to fit with between 6” and 10” of positive ease at the bust. for a tighter fit, size down.
